recipes.title: Chocolate cake in the microwave
instructions: Mix all the ingredients. It is important that the dough is runny, so you may need more milk.
Bake in the microwave for 2 minutes on high power.
Leave to cool for 2 minutes.
Serve with vanilla ice cream (or condensed milk).

recipes.title: Banana smoothie with peanut butter
instructions: Wash, peel, and slice the bananas.
Mix everything together and blend.

recipes.title: Tuna salad sandwich
ingredients: 145g can tuna (sunflower oil, olive oil or spring water are all fine), drained if needed
½ stick of celery, peeled, and finely diced
½ small red onion, finely diced
4 Little Gem lettuce leaves, washed and dried
instructions: To make the tuna salad tip all the ingredients into a bowl, season with a little salt and lots of pepper and use a fork to mash everything together until completely mixed. Will keep covered and chilled for a day.

To assemble the sandwiches pile and spread the tuna salad over two slices of the bread. Add the cucumber and lettuce, then spread the remaining slices with the mayonnaise and use them to top the sandwiches. Press down on the sandwiches lightly, then halve (rectangles or triangles) and serve. Best eaten straightaway or pack into a reusable plastic container for lunch.

recipes.title: Cinnamon rolls
instructions: Mix warm milk, sugar, and yeast.
Add flour until the consistency resembles sour cream.
Leave the dough for 0.5-1 hour.
Add eggs and the remaining sifted flour, knead.
Leave in a bowl greased with butter for 1 hour, or in the refrigerator overnight.
Roll out the dough to a medium thickness, brush with butter, and sprinkle with a mixture of cinnamon and sugar.
Roll the dough into a tube, cut the roll into buns, and place them on a baking sheet so that there is enough space between the buns (they will increase in size).
Wait 1 hour.
Bake for 10-20 minutes at 190-200°C.

recipes.title: Shchi
ingredients: Small young cabbage - half a head
instructions: Pierce the onion with a stick
Cut the carrots into half rings or quarters
Bring water to a boil, use just enough to cover the onion
Add the onion
Cut the cabbage, thinly slice carrots, and cut potatoes in cubes
Add the cabbage and cook for 10 minutes
Add the carrots and cook until almost done
Add the potatoes
Fry the chicken and add to the soup when the potatoes are almost cooked.
Add the spices and cook for a few minutes
Add salt, bring to a boil, turn off the heat
Ideally let the soup cool down and leave it in the fridge overnight before serving
Serve hot with a spoon of sour cream or greek yoghurt and black bread.

recipes.title: Chicken broth
instructions: Boil salted water
Add chicken and cook for 20 minutes
Remove meat and cut into pieces
Fry vegetables
Boil potatoes, add vermicelli
Add fried vegetables and meat

recipes.title: Rassolnik
instructions: Fry finely chopped onion, carrot, cucumbers, adding them gradually (depending on how cooked you like them).
Boil the water, add rinsed barley, cook on slow-medium heat until almost done
Add veggies and potatoes cut in cubes
Dissolve tomato paste in a cup of water, add to the soup
Add spices
Add cucumber marinade, soup should taste a little sour.
When cooked - add salt to taste.

recipes.title: Bean salad
instructions: Mix everything in a bowl, the beans may be preheated for a warm salad.

recipes.title: Vinaigrette
instructions: Boil the beets, carrots, and potatoes together until cooked (remove them from the pot when they are ready, potatoes first).
Peel and chop cooled veggies.
Mix veggies with cut cucumbers and dill.
Season with oil and salt to taste.
Ideally serve with salty and smoked canned fish and bread.

recipes.title: Oatmeal pancakes with banana
instructions: Pour milk over the oatmeal and leave for 5-15 minutes.
Mash the banana (for example, with a fork on a plate).
Mix the banana, oats, and egg. If the dough is too runny, add a little flour.
Fry in a pan.

recipes.title: "Potato" cake
instructions: Crush the cookies into crumbs.
In a saucepan, mix the sugar, 2/3 of the cocoa, and milk, stirring thoroughly.
Add butter.
Place on the stove. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.
Cool.
Mix the remaining cocoa and 1 tablespoon of cookies for sprinkling.
Mix the cooled mixture and cookies, add vanilla essence.
Form the cakes, roll them in the topping.
Leave in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.

recipes.title: Strawberry-banana smoothie
instructions: Wash, peel, and chop the fruit and berries.
Optionally, you can add cooked oatmeal for thickness, or use milk instead of water.
Mix everything together and blend until smooth.

recipes.title: Apple jam
instructions: Remove the cores from the apples and cut them into pieces.
Place the pieces in a wide saucepan, add water, and cook until the apples are soft.
Puree the apples or rub them through a sieve.
Mix the apple puree and sugar and cook until the desired consistency is reached.
Pour into sterilized jars.

recipes.title: Sauerkraut soup
instructions: Fry finely chopped onion, carrot, parsley root, garlic cloves adding them gradually (depending on how cooked you like them).
Boil the water, add meat and the cabbage, cook on slow-medium heat
Remove cooked meat
When the cabbage is almost soft - add the potatoes cut in cubes.
Dissolve tomato paste in a cup of water, add to the soup
Add spices and meat cut into small pieces
When potatoes are cooked - add salt to taste.

recipes.title: Ice cream with strawberry filling
instructions: Put 10 g of chocolate in each mold.
Dip the molds in hot water to melt the chocolate, spread it over the sides of the mold.
Whip the cream
Add the strawberry jam and mix
Divide the filling between the molds
Place in the freezer for 4 hours

recipes.title: Yeast pancakes or crepes
ingredients: Yeast (based on the weight of the flour)
Flour (with or without additives, such as oatmeal)
Sugar (1 tablespoon per 1 kg of flour)
Milk (with or without added water, warm, but not above 40°C, not to kill the yeast)
instructions: It is convenient to mix cold milk with boiling water. Mix everything together (if you want pancakes, add more water to make the dough more liquid).
Cover and leave in a warm place until doubled in size (or overnight in the refrigerator).
Fry.

recipes.title: Stuffed peppers
instructions: Rinse and soak the rice.
Fry the minced meat with spices, green onions, and garlic.
Mix the tomato paste, hot sauce, salt, and water.
Remove core from the peppers but leave the top part to cover them later.
Stuff the peppers with the minced meat mixture.
Place the peppers tightly in a baking dish
Pour the sauce over them, put top parts back..
Cook on slow heat for about 40 minutes.

recipes.title: Oat pancakes
instructions: Pour milk over the oatmeal and leave for 5-15 minutes
Add eggs, mix well
Add a little flour if the dough is too runny
Place in a frying pan, fry until cooked on both sides
Place cheese, ham, and sauces on one side
Fold in half, heat slightly in a frying pan to melt the cheese

recipes.title: Potato casserole
instructions: Grate the potatoes and squeeze out the excess liquid.
Place half of the potatoes in a greased baking dish.
Spread the minced meat on top, season with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle with green onions or sautéed onions.
Grate the cheese, mix with the remaining potatoes, add the eggs, stir, add the spices and sour cream
Spread the mixture over the minced meat
Preheat the oven to 180°C
Bake the casserole for about 1 hour

recipes.title: English muffins
ingredients: Fast-acting yeast - according to the amount of flour
instructions: Combine the flour, yeast, salt, and sugar, and mix thoroughly.
Add the oil, milk, and water, and knead the dough until smooth.
Grease a bowl well with oil and place the dough in it.
Pull the dough from one edge, fold it into the center, and repeat 5-6 times (lift and fold technique). Leave the dough for 15 minutes. Repeat 3 more times. Knead - leave - knead - leave - knead.
Put the dough in the refrigerator overnight.
Prepare a baking sheet - sprinkle with semolina.

Divide the dough into equal parts (90 g each), roll into balls. Flatten slightly (they should be no more than 3 cm thick), dip each side in semolina and place on the baking sheet. There should be 2-5 cm between the buns.
Cover with a towel or plastic wrap and leave at room temperature for 1-2 hours.
Heat a frying pan over medium heat. Cook each muffin for 7-8 minutes on each side.
Allow to cool completely (you can even leave them overnight).
Store at room temperature for 3-4 days. Frozen, they will keep for up to 3 months.

recipes.title: Cheesecakes (syrniki)
ingredients: Flour - enough to make the dough not too runny
instructions: Mix all ingredients
One syrnik is about one tablespoon. If desired, each syrnik can be rolled in flour before frying.
Form a ball from the dough, flatten it until syrnik is about 2-3 cm thick.
Fry in a greased heated pan on both sides until cooked through and crispy on the outside.

recipes.title: Quesadilla with potatoes
instructions: Wash and peel the potatoes, cut them into cubes, and boil for 10-15 minutes.
Fry the ham, peas and corn.
Mash the potatoes and add black pepper.
Grate the salty cheese on a fine grater and add to the potatoes.
Add the ham, peas, and corn.
Spread tomato sauce on the tortilla; you can add hot sauce if you like.
Sprinkle with grated cream cheese.
Place the filling on half of the tortilla, fold it over, and fry on both sides.

recipes.title: Burrito muffins
instructions: Roll the wraps into a roll
Cut to fit the muffin tins
Place in the molds
Pour in the eggs
Add the filling
Bake in the oven until done

recipes.title: Burritos
instructions: Prepare the sauce: simmer the tomatoes, add tomato paste for extra flavor, add beans, cooked meat, garlic, spices, hot sauce to taste, salt, honey or sugar to taste.
Optionally, heat the entire burrito in a pan until golden brown.
Place lettuce and sauce on the tortilla, sprinkle with corn, add fresh vegetables.

recipes.title: Shortbread cookies with berries
instructions: Heat the eggs and butter to room temperature.
Knead the butter
Add powdered sugar, mix well
Add the egg, mix
Sift the flour, add a pinch of salt, mix gently
Place the dough on parchment paper
Roll out between two sheets of parchment paper to a thickness of ~3 mm
Refrigerate for 30 minutes
Cut the berries into rings, sprinkle with sugar, place on napkins to dry slightly (20 minutes).
Cut cookies out of the dough.
Pat the berries dry and decorate the cookies.
Bake for 30 minutes at 150°C.

recipes.title: Fish in mustard
instructions: Prepare the fish: defrost and dry.
Heat the frying pan.
Coat each piece of fish with mustard on both sides, sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Bake on each side until done.

recipes.title: Shawarma
instructions: Fry the chicken with meat seasoning.
Cut the vegetables, optionally mix them into a salad.
Wrap into tortillas. On each tortilla place veggies mix, meat and a spoon of sauce.
Fry on greased pan until golden on both sides.

recipes.title: Sauerkraut
instructions: Finely chop and weigh the cabbage
Grate the carrot and add to the cabbage
Sprinkle the salt over the cabbage and knead until your hands become wet. Leave covered for half an hour.
Transfer the cabbage to a container (glass/glazed ceramic cylindrical pot).
Press down the cabbage.
Cover with a plate (that can fit into container) turned upside down and weigh down with a weight (a bottle of water or any clean and heavy glass object will do).
The liquid from cabbage should cover all the vegetables, otherwise add more weight, if this does not help - add a little water.
Twice a day, use a wooden spatula or stick to poke holes in the cabbage in a circular motion to release the gas (otherwise the cabbage may taste bitter).
Leave at room temperature until sour and tasty.
Transfer the cabbage to sterilized jars and store in the refrigerator.

recipes.title: Lazy casserole
instructions: Boil the potatoes and carrots, mash, and add salt.
Finely chop the onion and sauté in oil for 5 minutes.
Add the minced meat, fry over medium heat, season with pepper and salt
Add the beans to the minced meat, simmer everything together for 2-3 minutes
Serve the hot mashed potatoes with the minced meat and bean topping, sprinkle with herbs and chips

recipes.title: Carrot muffins
ingredients: Carrots without juice (grated on a fine grater and squeezed) - 150-180 g
Baking powder - 2 tsp (or 1 tsp vinegar + 0.5 tsp baking soda)
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180 degrees (preferably with convection).
Mix the eggs, zest, sugar, cinnamon, vegetable oil, and raisins.
Add the carrots to the mixture.
Add the baking powder (or vinegar and baking soda).
Divide the batter between the molds. There should be room for the cake to rise (for example, for paper liners in a metal cake pan - about 2 tablespoons of batter per mold).

Bake for about 20 minutes until browned or a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean (insert a toothpick into the cupcake to the full length, after removal there should be no traces on the toothpick).

recipes.title: Vanilla pudding
ingredients: Vanillin - 1 g (or vanilla sugar - 5 g instead of 1 tablespoon of sugar)
instructions: Heat the milk.
Mix part of the milk with the egg yolks, add sugar and starch.
Combine the mixture with warm milk and cook until the pudding thickens, stirring constantly.
When adding the mixture to the milk and after it is ready, strain through a fine sieve to remove lumps.
Pour into cups, cover with plastic wrap (the wrap should touch the mixture), and let cool.

recipes.title: Cabbage salad
ingredients: Sour cream and mayonnaise mixture or seed oil with lemon juice
instructions: Chop all the vegetables.
Mix with the peanuts, season with salt, pepper and the sauce.

recipes.title: Tomato cream soup
instructions: Wash and peel the vegetables.
Cut the potatoes into large pieces and boil until tender, 10-15 minutes.
Place the tomatoes in boiling water for 30-60 seconds, then transfer to ice water for 30 seconds. Remove and peel. Cut the flesh into small pieces.
Heat the vegetable oil in a heavy-bottomed saucepan, peel and finely chop the onion and garlic, add to the saucepan and fry for 1-2 minutes until soft.
Add the chopped tomatoes.
Simmer for 5-7 minutes over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
Pour in hot water (or potato broth), add tomato paste
Add salt, spices, bring to a boil, cook for 10 minutes over low heat
Add potatoes and cream
Blend with a blender

recipes.title: Okonomiyaki
instructions: Finely chop the cabbage
Cut the meat
Grate the cheese
Mix everything with the egg, water, salt, and pepper
Add flour until the mixture has the consistency of sour cream
Fry over medium heat like pancakes (try to make them thin)

recipes.title: Tuna sandwich
instructions: Finely chop the olives
Mix all the ingredients into paste.
Fry the toast (optional).
Make sandwiches.

recipes.title: Margherita pizza (Denis's recipe)
ingredients: Yeast - fast-acting or regular, see instructions
instructions: Activate the yeast according to the instructions, if necessary.
Mix the flour, water, salt, sugar, oil, and yeast. Knead with your hands for 10 minutes. Coat your hands with oil to prevent sticking.
Form the dough into a ball, place in a pan, cover with a damp towel, and leave for 1 hour.
Stretch the dough with your hands into a small sausage shape and divide into 3 equal parts.
Knead each part for 5 minutes, form a ball, place in a separate pan, cover with a damp towel, and leave for at least 2 hours.
Preheat the oven to the maximum temperature.
Carefully stretch each ball with your hands to 28-30 cm, keeping the edges intact, as if squeezing the ball from the center to the edges.
Drizzle the dough with a small amount of olive oil.
Add a layer of passata, oregano, basil leaves, mozzarella, and grated Parmesan.
Sprinkle flour on the baking sheet.
Place the baking sheet with the pizza as close to the heat source as possible for 5-7 minutes, depending on the oven.
Immediately after removing the baking sheet from the oven, shake it sharply to loosen the pizza, or you can carefully pry it off with a knife.

recipes.title: Darnitsky Bread
instructions: Mix the ingredients for the starter. Cover and leave for 12 hours at a temperature of 25 °C.
Mix the ingredients for the dough. Cover tightly and leave for 2 hours at a temperature of 25 °C.
Shape the dough into a loaf and smooth the surface.
Place in a greased baking tin and leave for 40 minutes.
Bake for 45 minutes at 230°C in the oven.
Or bake for 50 minutes in a pan with a splitter, covered with a baking sheet, on low heat.
Turn over and bake for another 20 minutes under the baking sheet to remove moisture.
Cool for at least 4 hours.

recipes.title: Fruit gummies
ingredients: Fruit or berries that are easy to blend - 450 g
instructions: Blend the fruit in a blender
Add lemon juice and honey to taste
Add water for liquid (3/4 cup of water for 450 g of fruit, juice of 2 lemons, and 1/3 cup of honey)
Add 1 teaspoon of agar-agar to 1 cup of the mixture.
Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-low heat, stirring constantly.
Turn off the heat and stir for another 2 minutes.
Pour the mixture into molds and let cool for at least 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Scrambled eggs with tomatoes
instructions: Cut the tomatoes into rings
Cut out the middle (leave only the outer shell)
Finely chop the middles, add chopped greens
Add flour and eggs, mix well
Heat a frying pan, grease with oil, place the tomato rings on it
Pour the mixture into each ring
Fry on both sides until done

recipes.title: Cottage cheese casserole
instructions: Mix everything except the raisins.
Blend with an immersion blender until smooth, add the raisins, and stir.
Divide the mixture among muffin tins.
Bake in an air fryer. For a serving of 6 pieces, set the temperature to 160 degrees and the time to 17 minutes.

recipes.title: Mochi in the microwave
ingredients: - or water with colored berry syrup
instructions: Mix all ingredients in a glass container until smooth.
Cover with plastic wrap and heat in the microwave for about 3 minutes (the time depends on the power of the oven).
Indicator of dough readiness: it is very elastic and stretchy, and becomes more colorful as the flour bakes and loses its whiteness.
Cool the dough without opening the wrap.
Sprinkle starch on a board, carefully roll out the starch-dusted dough, and cut it into pieces large enough to wrap the filling.

or the filling: ricotta / very thick jam / fruit / chocolate, and combinations thereof. The main thing is that the filling is not wet, otherwise the dough will fall apart. You can freeze the filling in portions to make it easier to wrap it in the dough.
Seal each pastry like a dumpling and turn it seam-side down, shaping it into a ball.
Eat immediately or store in the refrigerator for no more than 12 hours. For longer storage, place in the freezer.

recipes.title: Fish soup
instructions: Thinly slice carrots, and cut potatoes in cubes
Poke holes in the washed and peeled onions.
Boil the onions in water for 20 min.
Add carrot, boil for 15 min.
Add potatoes, boil until done.
Add the fish and the spices and cook for another 5 minutes.

recipes.title: Eggplant "Pizza"
instructions: Wash the eggplant and cut it in half.
Make cuts in the flesh to form diamond shapes, rub the surface with a small amount of salt and olive oil.
Line an air fryer pan with parchment paper and place the eggplant halves skin-side up. Bake for 30 minutes at 160 degrees Celsius.
Chop the tomato in any way you like, mix with tomato paste and a pinch of salt. Chop the garlic and add to the tomatoes.
Turn the eggplants over and spread the tomatoes on top. Bake for another 10 minutes at 180 degrees Celsius.
Sprinkle grated cheese on each half and bake for another 5 minutes at 180 degrees Celsius.
Serve hot with slices of bread.

recipes.title: Lentil soup
instructions: Boil the lentils until soft (green - 20 min., red - 10 min.).
Chop the tomatoes.
Fry the onion, carrot, and bell pepper, then add the meat.
Cut the potatoes and add them to the lentils along with the fried vegetables.
Cook for another 20 minutes until the potatoes are done.
Season with salt, pepper, cilantro, or other herbs.

recipes.title: Pea pancakes
instructions: Drain the peas into a bowl.
Add the egg to the pea water and stir well
Add the flour in portions until the desired consistency is achieved
Add the spices and salt
Add the peas
Fry in a pan
Serve with mayonnaise, ketchup, or hot sauce.

recipes.title: Tortillas with zucchini and corn
instructions: Sauté the zucchini with oil in a frying pan until soft.
Add the corn and fry a little.
Remove the mixture from the pan.
Place the zucchini and corn mixture and grated cheese on one side of the tortilla and fold in half.
Heat on both sides until golden brown.

recipes.title: Coconut cookies in the microwave
instructions: Mix everything except the flakes.
Add the flakes until the dough is thick enough to form cookies, knead well.
Form cookies, place on paper, bake for 1-2 minutes in the microwave.

recipes.title: Bigos
instructions: Chop the cabbage
Simmer until soft
Add tomato paste, simmer for another 5 minutes
Add chopped sausage, spices, and a little oil
Simmer for a few more minutes

recipes.title: Boiled eggs
instructions: Place the eggs in cold water and bring to a boil over medium heat.
Cook for 4-6 minutes for soft-boiled eggs, or 8 minutes for hard-boiled eggs.

recipes.title: Pancakes
instructions: Break the eggs into a deep bowl, add salt and sugar, and stir with a whisk.
Add milk and stir well.
Add flour in portions, stir well, and break up any lumps.
Add oil.
Adjust the consistency of the batter by adding water or flour. A thinner batter is for pancakes, a thicker batter is for fritters.
Fry in a pan
Serve with yoghurt, fruit jam, or wrap in cheese and heat until it melts.

recipes.title: Cottage cheese spread
instructions: Mix everything, choose proportions according to your taste, the paste should not be runny.
Spread it on toast or make lavash rolls with veggies and cheese.

recipes.title: Semolina porridge
instructions: Boil the water.
Add the milk.
When the mixture comes to a boil, lower the heat and slowly add the semolina while stirring.
Cook on low heat until thickened.

recipes.title: Fruit salad
ingredients: Sour cream + sugar or honey, or fruit yogurt for dressing
instructions: Cut all the fruit
Mix
Dress

recipes.title: Chicken roast with potatoes
instructions: Cut the chicken into small pieces.
Place the chicken in a bowl, add 0.5 tsp of salt and paprika, 2 pinches of black pepper, and 1 tbsp of vegetable oil. Mix well.
Pour the oil into a deep, wide frying pan and heat it up, then add the meat.
Fry the meat on all sides over medium heat for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally, then transfer to a plate.
Cut the onion into thin half-rings and the potatoes into quarters.
Place the potatoes in the pan with the oil from the chicken and fry over medium heat for 12-14 minutes.
Clean the bell pepper, cut into thin slices, and cut the tomato into medium-sized pieces. Finely chop the peeled garlic and greens with a knife.
Remove the potatoes from the pan, add the onion to the oil, and fry for 5 minutes, stirring.
Add the pepper to the onion and fry for another 5 minutes.
Add the potatoes, chicken, tomatoes, garlic, and herbs, and stir.
Add salt, pepper, and paprika, stir, and cover the pan with a lid.
Cook over medium heat for 10 minutes until fully cooked.

recipes.title: Rye bread
instructions: Mix the ingredients for the starter. Cover and leave for 12 hours at a temperature of 25 °C.
Mix the ingredients for the dough. Cover tightly and leave for 2 hours at 25 °C.
Shape the dough into a tight ball, sprinkle with rye flour, and place in a proofing basket for 40 minutes.
Bake for 30 minutes at 250 °C.
Cool for at least 4 hours

recipes.title: Chicken with pesto
instructions: Cut the raw chicken breast lengthwise into long strips
Place the pieces in a hot frying pan
Coat each piece with pesto and sprinkle with salt, bake on each side until done
Use for sandwiches or serve with side dishes.

recipes.title: Udon with chicken, mushrooms and vegetables
ingredients: To taste: ginger, hot pepper, soy sauce with oyster sauce and honey, or soy sauce with ketchup/tomato paste and honey
instructions: Cut the carrots and peppers and fry in a pan with a little oil
Fry the chicken/mushrooms with spices
Boil the udon (until slightly undercooked), transfer to the pan with the chicken, add a little water from the pasta pot
Add the vegetables
Add the seasonings and sauce
Sprinkle with sesame seeds

recipes.title: Potato cream soup with broccoli and cheese
ingredients: Chicken breast on the bone - 500 g
instructions: Wash and peel the vegetables
Prepare the broth from the chicken breast:
Cut the breast into pieces
Pour in 1.5 liters of water and place on the stove.
When it boils, remove all the foam.
Add the bay leaf.
Peel the onion and carrots, add half of the onion and coarsely chopped carrots to the broth.
Cook covered over low heat for 45 minutes.
You will need 300 ml of broth for the soup; the rest can be frozen, and the meat can be used for salads.
Dice the onion and carrot and sauté in vegetable oil for 5-7 minutes.
Peel and coarsely chop the potatoes.
Grate the cheese on a medium grater.
Wash the broccoli and cut into small florets.
Boil the broccoli in a separate pot for 3 minutes, then drain in a colander.
Transfer the sautéed onions and carrots to a pot, add the potatoes, pour in 300 ml of broth, and cook until the potatoes are done.
Remove the pot from the heat and blend the contents with a blender.
Add the cream and blend again.
Return the pot to the heat, add the cheese, and reduce the heat to low.
Stir the soup until the cheese has melted.
Add the broccoli, stir, and remove from the heat.

recipes.title: Pilaf
instructions: Make a sauté from onions and carrots - fry finely chopped onions over low heat with a small amount of oil, then add grated carrots. The carrots should soften and brown in places.
Fry the chicken leg in a separate pan on both sides over medium heat until crispy.
Place the chicken and onions with carrots at the bottom of the pot. Place the rice, spices, and garlic on top. Pour water into the pot, 1 finger joint above the level of the rice.
Cook until the rice is ready without opening the pot or stirring.
